LO1.description: Recall OSI and TCP/IP layered architectures

LO2.description: Explain reverse proxies and load balancers

LO4.description: Analyse packet captures to trace HTTP flows

LO5.description: Design verification strategies for network services

LO6.description: Evaluate system behaviour under various conditions

questions.stem: Which OSI layer is responsible for logical addressing (IP)?
questions.explanation: The Network Layer (Layer 3) manages IP addressing and packet routing between different networks.

questions.stem: How many packets are exchanged in a TCP three-way handshake?
questions.explanation: The TCP three-way handshake involves exactly 3 packets: SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK.

questions.stem: Which protocol provides reliable, ordered delivery of data?
questions.explanation: TCP provides reliable delivery with acknowledgements, ordered delivery with sequence numbers and flow control.

questions.stem: A load balancer is configured with round-robin algorithm and two backends. After sending 6 requests, what is the expected distribution?

options.a: Random distribution depending on server load
options.b: All 6 requests to the first backend

questions.explanation: Round-robin distributes requests in a deterministic alternating pattern, resulting in 3 requests to each backend.

questions.stem: In Docker Compose, if a service defines "ports: ['8080:80']", what does this mapping mean?

options.a: Container port 8080 maps to host port 80
options.b: Host port 8080 maps to container port 80

questions.explanation: Docker port mapping format is HOST:CONTAINER. '8080:80' means host port 8080 forwards to container port 80.

questions.stem: What is the primary purpose of the Transport layer in the TCP/IP model?
questions.explanation: The Transport layer provides end-to-end communication between applications using port numbers.

questions.stem: Which Docker command shows only running containers with names starting with "week14"?
questions.explanation: docker ps --filter name=^week14 uses regex anchor for 'starts with' on running containers only.

questions.stem: In Wireshark, which display filter shows only HTTP traffic to or from port 8080?
questions.explanation: tcp.port == 8080 captures all TCP traffic on that port. 'http' filter only works for port 80 by default.

questions.stem: A packet capture shows: SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK, HTTP GET, HTTP 200, FIN, ACK, FIN, ACK. How many TCP connections were established?
questions.explanation: This sequence represents a single complete TCP connection: establishment (3-way), data exchange, termination (4-way).

questions.stem: After stopping one backend, the load balancer returns 502 errors for ~50% of requests. What is the most likely cause?

options.b: Round-robin still routing to dead backend

questions.explanation: The 50% error rate matches round-robin behaviour when health check has not yet detected the backend failure.

questions.stem: A system shows: Backend 1 receives 70% of requests, Backend 2 receives 30%. The load balancer is configured for round-robin. Which explanation is MOST likely?

options.a: Bug in the load balancer algorithm
options.b: Sticky sessions enabled for some clients

questions.explanation: Sticky sessions override round-robin for returning clients, causing uneven distribution.

questions.stem: Which verification approach provides the HIGHEST confidence that a containerised service is functioning correctly?

options.c: Send test request and validate response content

questions.explanation: End-to-end testing with response validation verifies the entire request/response path.

questions.stem: Design a health check strategy for a load-balanced web application. Which combination provides the BEST coverage?

options.b: HTTP GET to /health endpoint with 200 OK validation
options.c: HTTP GET to /health with response body validation and timeout

questions.explanation: Option C combines HTTP (application layer), dedicated endpoint, body validation and timeout handling.

questions.stem: Design a Docker Compose network topology for: 2 backend servers, 1 load balancer (public) and 1 database (private). Which design is MOST secure?

options.a: All containers on default bridge network
options.b: Single custom network for all containers
options.c: Frontend network (LB + backends) and backend network (backends + DB)
options.d: Each container on its own network

questions.explanation: Network segmentation isolates DB from direct LB access while allowing necessary communication paths.

questions.stem: Create a troubleshooting procedure for "Connection refused" errors when accessing http://localhost:8080. What is the CORRECT order?

options.a: Check firewall → Check DNS → Check container → Check port
options.b: Check container running → Check port mapping → Check service logs → Check firewall
options.c: Check DNS → Check container → Check firewall → Check logs
options.d: Check logs → Check container → Check network → Check DNS

questions.explanation: Systematic troubleshooting follows OSI model from application down: container status, port mapping, logs, then firewall.
